newsitem.title: UK: Arcadian to redevelop Great Eastern Hotel.
newsitem.headline: Arcadian to redevelop Great Eastern Hotel.

text.p: British property developer Arcadian International Plc said on Tuesday it had signed an agreement to redevelop the Great Eastern Hotel at London's Liverpool Street railway station.

Under the terms of the 43 million stg revelopment deal, Arcadian will take a 125 year lease from a subsidiary of The British Land Company Plc and British Land will provide 30 million stg of development funds.
Arcadian will jointly develop the hotel with Conran Holdings Ltd. Both companies will take a 50 percent stake in Great Eastern and each provide 6.5 million stg of funds.
The hotel will close in April and is scheduled to reopen in 1999, Arcadian said.
